thread.title: Phillies' game against Marlins postponed by rain
thread.title_full: Phillies' game against Marlins postponed by rain

title: Phillies' game against Marlins postponed by rain
text:
TOM REIFSNYDER, Daily News Staff Writer reifsnt@phillynews.com Posted: Sunday, October 4, 2015, 3:01 AM 
WITH YESTERDAY'S game postponed because of rain, the Phillies will open their final series of the season against the Miami Marlins as part of a single-admission doubleheader today starting at 4:05 p.m. Gates open at 3:05 p.m. 
Aaron Harang (6-15) will go against Marlins righthander Tom Koehler (11-14) in the first game, followed by rookie righthander Alec Asher (0-5) and Marlins lefthander Justin Nicolino (4-4) in the nightcap. 
Asher, 23, had his shortest, and one of his worst, outings as a big-leaguer Wednesday in a 7-5 win over National League East-champion New York Mets, allowing five earned runs and two homers on three hits in only two-thirds of an inning. Asher, who's sporting a 9.00 ERA, tossed 43 pitches while facing seven batters. 
The Phillies' three-game sweep of the Mets this week was surely a morale booster for the clubhouse, but the team's effort to avoid its first 100-loss season since 1961 has placed their draft position in question. More coverage
